alert.note: Alert for Henry; Randolph; Rush (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 01 at 3:11AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Rush, southern Randolph and southern Henry Counties through 345 AM EDT... At 310 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles west of Dublin, or 9 miles west of Cambridge City, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Rush, southern Randolph and southern Henry Counties, including the following locations... Greensboro, Straughn, Losantville, Modoc, Dunreith, Lynn, Spiceland, Mooreland and Lewisville. This includes Interstate 70 between mile markers 119 and 133. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
